      static double[] normalise(double[] vector, IterableInt entries)
      Normalise the given entries in the vector in-place such that that they sum to 1, I.e., for all indizes of entries, set
      vector[s] = vector[s] / sum, where
      sum = sum_{s in entries} (vector[s])
      If {@code sum = 0.0}, all entries are set to {@code NaN}.
      static void selectMidpoint(double[] soln_below, double[] soln_above)
      Select midpoint from two interval iteration solution vectors.

      • doublesAreClose

        public static boolean doublesAreClose(double[] d1,
                                      double[] d2,
                                      IterableInt indizes,
                                      double epsilon,
                                      boolean abs)
        See if, for all the entries given by the indizes iterator, two arrays of doubles are all within epsilon of each other (relative or absolute error).
        Considers Inf == Inf and -Inf == -Inf.

        Considers Inf == Inf and -Inf == -Inf.

      • ensureMonotonicityFromBelow

        public static void ensureMonotonicityFromBelow(double[] old_values,
                                               double[] new_values)
        Ensure monotonicity from below for interval iteration solution vectors. Compares the old and new values and overwrites the new value with the old value if that is larger.
        Parameters:
        old_values - old solution vector
        new_values - new solution vector

      • ensureMonotonicityFromAbove

        public static void ensureMonotonicityFromAbove(double[] old_values,
                                               double[] new_values)
        Ensure monotonicity from above for interval iteration solution vectors. Compares the old and new values and overwrites the new value with the old value if that is smaller.
        Parameters:
        old_values - old solution vector
        new_values - new solution vector

      • checkMonotonicity

        public static void checkMonotonicity(double[] old_values,
                                     double[] new_values,
                                     boolean from_above)
                              throws PrismException
        Check for monotonicity: If the new_values are not element-wise less-than-equal the older values (for from_above == true), then throws an exception. If from_above == false, the logic is reversed, i.e., if the new_value is not greater-than-equal, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        old_values - the old values
        new_values - the new values
        from_above - the direction
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • selectMidpoint

        public static void selectMidpoint(double[] soln_below,
                                  double[] soln_above)
        Select midpoint from two interval iteration solution vectors. Stores the result in soln_below.
        Parameters:
        soln_below - solution vector from below
        soln_above - solution vector from above

      • normalise

        public static double[] normalise(double[] vector,
                                 IterableInt entries)
        Normalise the given entries in the vector in-place such that that they sum to 1, I.e., for all indizes of entries, set
        vector[s] = vector[s] / sum, where
        sum = sum_{s in entries} (vector[s])
        If {@code sum = 0.0}, all entries are set to {@code NaN}.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector
        entries - Iterable over the entries (must not contain duplicates)
        Returns:
        the altered vector

                                          java.lang.String separator)
        Create a string for an array of objects, with a specified separator, e.g. ["a","b","c"], "," -> "a,b,c"

      • findCycle

        public static int findCycle(boolean[][] matrix)
        Check for any cycles in an 2D boolean array representing a graph. Useful for checking for cyclic dependencies in connected definitions. Returns the lowest index of a node contained in a cycle, if there is one, -1 if not.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Square matrix of connections: matr[i][j] == true iff there is a connection from i to j.

      • convertMemoryStringtoKB

        public static long convertMemoryStringtoKB(java.lang.String mem)
                                    throws PrismException
        Convert a string representing an amount of memory (e.g. 125k, 50m, 4g) to the value in KB. If the letter prefix is omitted, we assume it is "k" (i.e. KB).
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • convertTimeStringtoSeconds

        public static int convertTimeStringtoSeconds(java.lang.String time)
                                      throws PrismException
        Convert a string representing an amount of time (e.g. 5s, 5m, 5h, 5d, 5w) to the value in seconds. If the unit is omitted, we assume it is seconds.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • convertBytesToMemoryString

        public static java.lang.String convertBytesToMemoryString(long bytes)
                                                   throws PrismException
        Convert a number of bytes to a string representing the amount of memory (e.g. 125k, 50m, 4g).
        Throws:
        PrismException

        Utility method to create a new PrintStream for a file, but any errors are converted to PrismExceptions
        Throws:
